newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: cricket-Young guides NZ to formidable tea score.
newsitem.headline: cricket-Young guides NZ to formidable tea score.

text.p: A fluent 94 not out by Bryan Young had put New Zealand in a commanding position at tea on the first day of the first cricket test against Sri Lanka on Friday.
New Zealand were 203 for two at the interval after Sri Lanka won the toss and sent them in to bat.
Opening batsman Young was six runs short of his second test century, while the other not-out batsman was new skipper Stephen Fleming, on three.
Young and Matt Horne enjoyed a highly profitable second wicket partnership of 140 in 146 minutes before Horne was dismissed for 66 in the penultimate over of the second session.
Horne, in just his third test innings, was positive and forthright from the outset.
He departed to the seventh ball delivered by medium pacer and Sri Lankan captain Arjuna Ranatunga when he offered an edge to Roshan Mahanama at second slip.
On an excellent batting pitch, Horne and Young went to lunch with their team's score at 92 for one following the loss of Blair Pocock for 18 in the morning session.
